CatDescriptText: George "Beefy" Moncelluzzo, welder, Mt. Lebanon, was part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, December 3, 1960, pg. A1 with question: "Do you think that integration in all schools in South should be effected immediately, or do you favor permitting a reasonable length of time? If so, how long a period do you consider as a "reasonable length of time?"  Answer reads: "It should be effective immediately and the faster the better.  The reason, is because I was raised in the Third Ward and my friends were people of all races."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of George "Beefy" Moncelluzzo wearing fedora and shield and fleur de lis patterned shirt, standing on Smithfield Street with B/G Restaurant sign in background
